From wildfox34 at gmail.com  Mon Aug  6 15:45:10 2007
From: wildfox34 at gmail.com (Mike Johnson)
Date: Mon, 6 Aug 2007 15:45:10 -0400
Subject: FL: Got a Debut/ Debate question...
In-Reply-To: <5A32A571-2326-4546-B4C6-6A86652E0DB5@flyingfox.biz>
References: <BAY139-W1157642DABD140BD6FFB69D7E50@phx.gbl>
	<5A32A571-2326-4546-B4C6-6A86652E0DB5@flyingfox.biz>
Message-ID: <68be40570708061245l780e3842s7ed92e6eec3f5186@mail.gmail.com>

I'd say a proper debut for any new suit is to go to a local furmeet.
Whether it's just a gathering around the TV to watch a movie, or going
out to the bowling alley or mini-golf course (get early permission
first!).  Usually, when I got a new suit... I took it to a nearby
bowling furmeet and debut it there among many furs that know me well.
Personally, I like doing that than waiting until the first con I get
to after getting a new suit to debut it.  That way if any flaws happen
to show somewhere (not that I think you have any, you did an excellent
job!), you can find out about them among a small crowd of furs instead
of having it happen while hundreds of furs watch. :)

Wildfox
http://www.chameleon.net/~wildfox/index.htm

From blueflyer18 at yahoo.com  Mon Aug  6 19:42:05 2007
From: blueflyer18 at yahoo.com (May Marshall)

Subject: FL: Two Piece Fursuit body
Message-ID: <134198.17329.qm@web38902.mail.mud.yahoo.com>

Hey all! Me again!

I have been wandering around all over the place, looking at body suits of some amazing fursuits out there and wondering how the heck i'm gonna be able to create something decent!!

Well, i've more then half way dont with my bodysuit, but i got to thinking about what i could do with the spare fur i have laying around besides sell it.

Have there been any really well constructed two piece body suits out there? Like, using a shirt and then some pants for the style. I would really appreciate the input if this is a good idea (like if i wanted to have the "topless" look but wear regular pants so as not to get too hot.) 

Does this two piece method actually look good, or just lazy and sloppy?

BlueFlyer

From mistletoe at wi.rr.com  Tue Aug  7 09:56:16 2007
From: mistletoe at wi.rr.com (mistletoe at wi.rr.com)
Date: Tue, 07 Aug 2007 08:56:16 -0500
Subject: FL: Two Piece Fursuit body
In-Reply-To: <134198.17329.qm@web38902.mail.mud.yahoo.com>
References: <134198.17329.qm@web38902.mail.mud.yahoo.com>
Message-ID: <fe8994c98e63c.8e63cfe8994c9@rdc-kc.rr.com>

Blueflyer wrote:
> Have there been any really well constructed two piece body suits 
> out there? Like, using a shirt and then some pants for the style. 
> I would really appreciate the input if this is a good idea (like 
> if i wanted to have the "topless" look but wear regular pants so 
> as not to get too hot.) 

My Mistletoe suit is a two-piece, for just that reason. It's nice 
being able to mix-and-match, depending on what clothes I want to wear 
with it. But that's the thing; I always have to wear some kind of 
clothes with it, to hide how the top isn't connected to the bottom. I 
can never go completely "naked" in the fur. ;) So I usually wear 
shorts or a skirt, depending on whether I want to look tomboy or 
feminine.

Also, not as much fur is required to make a two-piece. Sorry I don't 
have any photos online yet to illustrate this.

Happy suiting!
Wendy

From Tripncheata at aol.com  Tue Aug  7 10:06:58 2007
From: Tripncheata at aol.com (Tripncheata at aol.com)
Date: Tue, 7 Aug 2007 10:06:58 EDT
Subject: FL: Two Piece Fursuit body
Message-ID: <c3b.18ae0a63.33e9d682@aol.com>

Hey,
  I did a two piece once. It's true, it is hard to keep it from coming part 
if there is no form of attachment. But I found that a zipper like that of a 
jacket works quit well. it would work somewhat like those pants where you can 
take off the legs. You just have to make sure there is a flap that will fit over 
it and you picked out a smaller zipper other wise it will make the fur bulge 
out when it tries to lay over it. The benefit of this is that if you don't 
think you want to wear the full thing you can wear just the top to just the bottom 
with a T-shirt or a pair of pants the only think to really keep in mind is 
your stretch, how far you can bend before the fur rides up or moves down that 
way you will know where your restrictions are. It can also help to sew a band of 
elastic through the two seams to keep think in place if they aren't zipped.
 
Just sharing a little I'm not sure if it will work for you.
 
 
OmenVixen.

http://discover.aol.com/memed/aolcom30tour

From santafox at comcast.net  Tue Aug  7 10:53:18 2007
From: santafox at comcast.net (Santa Fox)
Date: Tue, 07 Aug 2007 14:53:18 +0000
Subject: FL: Two Piece Fursuit body
Message-ID: <080720071453.2473.46B8875E00086FB1000009A922007374789801000E9B020E9C@comcast.net>

> Have there been any really well constructed two piece body suits out there? 
> Like, using a shirt and then some pants for the style. I would really appreciate 
> the input if this is a good idea (like if i wanted to have the "topless" look 
> but wear regular pants so as not to get too hot.) 
> 
> Does this two piece method actually look good, or just lazy and sloppy?

I've done a two-piece design on three of my costume puppet creations (dragon, kangaroo, and stork).  However, this was due to design needs because of their long necks, rather than to be able to wear only half the costume in a partial suit configuration.

What I did in each case was to have the top half overlap the bottom half by about five inches, which gives me the ability to be active without worrying about the two halves pulling away from each other.  I also use suspenders on the lower half of each costume to make sure lower halves don't fall down on me.  Of course, this design looks best if the belly is padded a little bit, as the padded belly helps to keep the overlapped fabric of the upper half from working loose too easily.  Fortunately, with each of the characters I used this design on, a padded belly made perfect sense.

I must admit, though, that I'm moving away from that design in favor of a all-one-piece design (as with my Billy Goat) for my future characters that might have long extended necks, because I've never been that crazy about how the overlap looks.  On the stork (all white all the way around the abdomen), it looks pretty decent, but on the kangaroo and dragon (light bellies and darker fur/fleece on the backs and sides of the abdomen), it's hard to keep the light-color belly sections perfectly aligned when I'm running around a lot, and once the upper and lower belly sections get out of alignment, the misalignment becomes a bad eye-cather that reminds people that it's only a costume character.

Cheers,
Santa Fox

--
Santa Fox's Den - http://santafox.home.comcast.net/

From fox at flyingfox.biz  Fri Aug 10 13:47:49 2007
From: fox at flyingfox.biz (Fox Kinsman)

In-Reply-To: <102619.78490.qm@web57602.mail.re1.yahoo.com>

Message-ID: <5EAA1F2A-F853-45A2-869F-5C2AE03013A7@flyingfox.biz>

How many other people like to work with helmets?
Just curious,

Scape

From santafox at comcast.net  Fri Aug 10 14:54:54 2007
From: santafox at comcast.net (Santa Fox)
Date: Fri, 10 Aug 2007 18:54:54 +0000
Subject: FL: Helmets...
Message-ID: <081020071854.975.46BCB47E00004F03000003CF22092299279801000E9B020E9C@comcast.net>

 -------------- Original message ----------------------
From: Fox Kinsman <fox at flyingfox.biz>
> How many other people like to work with helmets?
> Just curious,
> 
> Scape

My first fox head was built on a bicycle helmet.  At the time, I thought I was going to like the idea, but over the three years I used that head I grew more and more to want a simpler design.  So, when I rebuilt my fox costume I went with an all-foam head that fits snugly on my head (I wear a balaclava under the costume head for comfort.)  Having used this new head for over a year now, I don't think I'd ever go back to a helmet-based design.

That's just my opinion, and there are indeed some positives to building on a helmet.  It's all a matter of what you want to do with the head and what your personal tastes in head design are.

Cheers,
Santa Fox

--
Santa Fox's Den - http://santafox.home.comcast.net/

had the head remade without it.

i like to work with bicycle helmets... but i like a slightly oversized 
caracature head on my mascots... more toony... and the way i make them with 
a lot of airflow gives enough room inside to be really breathable.

From fox at mchsi.com  Sat Aug 11 12:45:18 2007
From: fox at mchsi.com (fox)
Date: Sat, 11 Aug 2007 11:45:18 -0500
Subject: FL: Helmets
Message-ID: <000c01c7dc37$00532730$6401a8c0@FoxDen>

Ive only used a helmet once. It was a street hockey goalie helmet for my 
gryphon. The existing cage on the front provided the structure I needed to 
attach the beak. And the helmet was small enough as to not make the head too 
big. (I tend to go toward smaller "realistic" sized). I will also admit that 
I "borrowed" that idea from Legend as his was built on the same foundation. 
Reinventing the wheel takes time and a lot of engineering paper.

For the "toony" style foam head, a bicycle helmet is a pretty good pick as 
the chin strat would help keep the head on and pointed the right way.




From dia at critter.net  Sat Aug 11 14:23:50 2007
From: dia at critter.net (dia at critter.net)
Date: Sat, 11 Aug 2007 13:23:50 -0500 (CDT)
Subject: FL: Helmets...
In-Reply-To: <mailman.5.1186848008.5798.fursuit-list@lists.fursuit.org>
References: <mailman.5.1186848008.5798.fursuit-list@lists.fursuit.org>
Message-ID: <13398.67.161.42.245.1186856630.squirrel@secure.critter.net>

I usually work with Balaclavas (nice and light). But for my Drama Llama I
needed something that would hold up to a bit of weight (since the
neck/head were ABOVE my human head)

I used a baseball batting helmet (just like this!
http://www.onlinesports.com/images/mw-abpbhs.gif ), took the lip off of
it, and added a chin strap so I had good movement.

Here is his page (with pictures on how I made him)
http://www.chameleon.net/~diadexxus/ljplex/index.html

-J

From anthrofurry at yahoo.com  Sun Aug 12 19:43:36 2007
From: anthrofurry at yahoo.com (Kit the cougar)
Date: Sun, 12 Aug 2007 16:43:36 -0700 (PDT)
Subject: FL: Helmets...
In-Reply-To: <5EAA1F2A-F853-45A2-869F-5C2AE03013A7@flyingfox.biz>
Message-ID: <361640.45690.qm@web57710.mail.re3.yahoo.com>

I modified my first Darkstone Realms head using a motorcycle helmet.  Really stabilized things while in suit and allowed for a bit of extra head movement and better in-suit acting.  Also, I wore the suit on my motorcycles a couple of times (only in closed courses, of course...usually...sometimes) too!  Video is here: http://video.google.com/videoplay?docid=-3504801049849661036&q=fox+on+a+motorcycle&total=147&start=0&num=10&so=0&type=search&plindex=1

~Kit (the cougar)

I'm having pretty good luck so far with Scape's helmet.  The horns  
are attached with brackets and hardware so they are solid (solid  
enough to headbutt a tossed yoga ball!;)  The chin strap has been  
very helpful keeping the head on with the slight ungainliness of big  
horns too.  fun fun

Hello all,

I've still got some rolls of fur and I'm starting the gears turning  
in my head on how I can make them available to you.  I don't see any  
fur for sale on furbid, so I can't find a good learning example for  
my self.  I do believe that the auction route is the way to go to be  
fair to everyone, but I was wondering though about swatches -I didn't  
buy any fur for Scape without getting swatches first.  Is there a  
good way or some sort of protocol to follow with swatches and auctions?
I'm new to this and confused but I just want to do it the right way.
Thanks for any help you may have!

Scape

From blue_heel at fsun.net  Mon Aug 20 21:11:11 2007
From: blue_heel at fsun.net (Doctor)
Date: Mon, 20 Aug 2007 20:11:11 -0500
Subject: FL: MFM: It's nearly upon us.
Message-ID: <6.0.0.22.2.20070820200239.024c2628@mail.fsun.net>


---
Rusty: I put a dollar in, I got a car. I put a dollar in, I got a car. I 
put a dollar in, I got a car. I put a dollar in, I got a car.
Clark Griswold: How did you win four cars?
Rusty: You know, put in a dollar, win a car. Put in another dollar, win 
another car...
Clark Griswold: Give me the keys. Audrey, you drive the white one; Ellen, 
the red one
[a Ferrari]
Clark Griswold: , Rusty, you drive the Mustang, and I'll drive the big, 
black one
[a Hummer]
Clark Griswold: . After you, Mr. Papagiorgio.

---

It doesn't matter what car you drive down to Memphis in a week and a few 
days, you just have to be there.  Fursuiters,  if you are there, don't 
forget to participate in the Masquarade.  Just remember that the signup for 
the event is on Friday night (check the schedule).  Also, if you are a 
fursuiter, and don't have an act, don't worry.  If you want to help out, I 
am looking for two fursuiters that aren't in any acts.  And there might be 
a few acts that might need extra furs, let me know that too.  It's coming 
up very soon.. very very soon, so if you have an act, make sure you're 
participating.  See you all there.

It's BIG, It's BOLD, and it's Vegas Baby

Blue

Blue Heeler SunFire

Furry Writer; art collector
www.fsun.net/blue_heel

But to confess. I love Role Master. Combat in RM is quite compacted
but all other skills are quite simple. Back to ironclaw. I do like the
XP system. A game that you don't have to fight to get XP will always
be a good start for a new RPG. Like in D&D how is a magic thrower to
advance in level if he cant kill crap with one pointless spell and he
cant fight his way out of a paper bag.

Donkey

I have one in my geek collection but I'm, um... using it lol!
I'd say it's high time to hit thrift shops or go yard sailin' ;)  Ham  
radio fests are a good place to find tons of old fixer-upper type  
equipment for real cheap too.  Or you could make one out of old junk,  
even black tape, foamboard, phone cord -that just gives the  
impression of the prop.

From sewcrazy at brightusa.net  Fri Aug 31 12:15:48 2007
From: sewcrazy at brightusa.net (Sharon)
Date: Fri, 31 Aug 2007 12:15:48 -0400
Subject: FL: Looking for a radio costume prop
In-Reply-To: <325075.75339.qm@web50309.mail.re2.yahoo.com>
Message-ID: <200708311615.l7VGFmgG030190@sparky.bright.net>


Patch, try calling your local PD. Ours has a box of dead stuff. No one knows
what to do with it, city property and all that stuff. Maybe you could ask to
borrow or purchase for scrap price. Explain to them your purpose and you
never know, they might be happy to help. Also, the dept has a favorite
repair shop for their radios. Check the local area for a radio service
repair. They are also sure to have a morgue with dead ones.
Good Luck
Sharon

I am looking for a police-style radio with separate
corded mike, like the ones you see police/emergency
personnel wear.  It does not have to work (not working
preferred - I'm spending enough as it is), I just need
it as a prop.  Anyone have such an item in their geek

Date: Mon, 03 Sep 2007 10:36:07 +0000
Subject: FL: Fursuit Sunglasses
In-Reply-To: <8C9BBA88FDDCBAB-FA4-4997@WEBMAIL-DF06.sysops.aol.com>
Message-ID: <BAY114-F30CBD8476FF7B561A36C3BEDC90@phx.gbl>

I used a broken pair of aviator sunglasses and a wire coathnager to make a 
pair for my fursuits.  I cut them in half then hotglued (yeah, not that 
great) a peice of wire pewteen them then added longer pieces for the 
supports.

Here's a pic.
http://i242.photobucket.com/albums/ff152/Messerschmitt51/Accessories/fursuitSunglasses.jpg
And my gryphon wearing them.
http://i242.photobucket.com/albums/ff152/Messerschmitt51/Marcus/PS2/Relaxin.jpg

I hope this was a bit useful!

>

Subject: FL: Furfright Fursuiter Feast!
In-Reply-To: <b1c118750709142040ia4745d4se994df0b64ce7225@mail.gmail.com>
Message-ID: <BAY121-F233E4D2068B0AE285065AED0B90@phx.gbl>


I am planning to host a dinner for fursuit folk on Friday 10/19 at a 
restaurant near the hotel. This is an "out of suit" event where fursuiters 
can meet others and eat. There have been many similar gatherings at past 
cons.

I have yet to set an exact time or place. I am looking for input on where 
folks would like to eat along with a rough count. The exact details will be 
posted to closer to the con and the exact count won't be needed until a few 
days prior.

Here are some options you can vote on (All are within 3 miles of the hotel). 
  Please send a priavate off-list email to wallyfox98 at hotmail.com with 
your choice:

1) American Steakhouse- Buffet/Steak restaurant that can handle seperate 
checks and has very low prices.

2) Chinese Buffet- We have 2-3 choices!

3) Hometown Buffet

4) Athenian Diner - If they can handle us!

5) Other- TGI Friday's, Red Lobster, Chili's, Ruby Tuesday, Etc.

snuggles

Wally_Wabbit

From th3ent at gmail.com  Mon Oct  1 18:28:36 2007
From: th3ent at gmail.com (Richard Oakley)
Date: Mon, 1 Oct 2007 18:28:36 -0400
Subject: FL: quick introduction
In-Reply-To: <12841454.1191269391558.JavaMail.root@web28>
References: <12841454.1191269391558.JavaMail.root@web28>
Message-ID: <4f492b3d0710011528o5dbf3193x5f71a0b18022f1f8@mail.gmail.com>

Hey there everyone, I just got added to the mailing list today! I wanted to
say hi and give a brief introduction of why I joined this list.

Two years ago, 10/17/05, I had the idea that I wanted to be a centaur for
Halloween. To make matters more difficult, with two weeks to complete this
project I decided I wanted the back legs to move the way a "real" centaurs
legs would (back left follows front right, back right follows front left).

Fast Forward 1.9 weeks, October 30th, 11pm. I finished the frame out of
copper tube and couplings/t-joints, had re-created all the joints out of
hinges and springs, and sat staring at the finished frame. Needless to say
the fur-suit that would encompass the frame and myself was whipped together
so fast it looked absolutely horrible. I went to Salem, MA as Pan that year,
utilizing the fur legs and small leftover lengths of the copper tube to
create a pan-pipe.

The next year was very similar in time-line, but this time I gave myself
FOUR weeks, came up with a completely different "locomotion" design for the
back legs involving a large central wheel contained within the frame and
connections aimed at my legs, and the back legs. It worked, but again was
missing the realistic fur-suit and had some minor design flaws. This year I
was batman for Halloween, with the centaur frame and suit laying in my
closet.

Staying true to form, this year, Halloween Season 07, I again doubled the
time to prepare giving myself EIGHT weeks. This year, I utilized a 2-axle, 1
driveshaft, gear driven system. The frame w/rotating assembly much resembles
that of a car. The rotating assembly and it's frame will be completed
tomorrow, and then the skeleton of the centaur and the fur-suit will be
completed in what's left of october!

PHEW, I hope you all didn't actually read all that. So do any of you have a
web-site/ftp-site/storage of any kind with pictures of the creation of
realistic looking fursuits? I would be very interested in such a site.

On 10/1/07, Rainhopper <rainhopperroo at adelphia.net> wrote:

From donkeyears at gmail.com  Mon Oct  1 22:02:11 2007
From: donkeyears at gmail.com (Donkey)

Subject: FL: quick introduction

His Most Royal Highass, Donkey

On 10/1/07, Richard Oakley <th3ent at gmail.com> wrote:
> Hey there everyone, I just got added to the mailing list today! I wanted to
> say hi and give a brief introduction of why I joined this list.
>
> Two years ago, 10/17/05, I had the idea that I wanted to be a centaur for
> Halloween. To make matters more difficult, with two weeks to complete this
> project I decided I wanted the back legs to move the way a "real" centaurs
> legs would (back left follows front right, back right follows front left).
>
> Fast Forward 1.9 weeks, October 30th, 11pm. I finished the frame out of
> copper tube and couplings/t-joints, had re-created all the joints out of
> hinges and springs, and sat staring at the finished frame. Needless to say
> the fur-suit that would encompass the frame and myself was whipped together
> so fast it looked absolutely horrible. I went to Salem, MA as Pan that year,
> utilizing the fur legs and small leftover lengths of the copper tube to
> create a pan-pipe.
>
> The next year was very similar in time-line, but this time I gave myself
> FOUR weeks, came up with a completely different "locomotion" design for the
> back legs involving a large central wheel contained within the frame and
> connections aimed at my legs, and the back legs. It worked, but again was
> missing the realistic fur-suit and had some minor design flaws. This year I
> was batman for Halloween, with the centaur frame and suit laying in my
> closet.
>
> Staying true to form, this year, Halloween Season 07, I again doubled the
> time to prepare giving myself EIGHT weeks. This year, I utilized a 2-axle, 1
> driveshaft, gear driven system. The frame w/rotating assembly much resembles
> that of a car. The rotating assembly and it's frame will be completed
> tomorrow, and then the skeleton of the centaur and the fur-suit will be
> completed in what's left of october!
>
> PHEW, I hope you all didn't actually read all that. So do any of you have a
> web-site/ftp-site/storage of any kind with pictures of the creation of
> realistic looking fursuits? I would be very interested in such a site.
>
>
> On 10/1/07, Rainhopper <rainhopperroo at adelphia.net> wrote:
> > nice =) and yes definately, in march or april, the kangaroo is bouncing to
> a new continent. its going to be interesting explaining to the ozfurs that
> while I'm a kangaroo, I'm not an aussie roo ;P
> > ---- David Boccabella < marcwolf at marcwolf.org> wrote:

> > >
> > > I'm Marcwolf and I believer you are coming to Australia in a little
> while
> > > (I'm up in Brisbane)

> servo
> > > drived wagging tail :>
> > > Drop me a line
> > >
> > >
> > > Marcwolf
> > >

On 10/1/07, Richard Oakley <th3ent at gmail.com> wrote:
> Hey there everyone, I just got added to the mailing list today! I  
> wanted to
> say hi and give a brief introduction of why I joined this list.
>
> Two years ago, 10/17/05, I had the idea that I wanted to be a  
> centaur for
> Halloween. To make matters more difficult, with two weeks to  
> complete this
> project I decided I wanted the back legs to move the way a "real"  
> centaurs
> legs would (back left follows front right, back right follows front  
> left).
>
> Fast Forward 1.9 weeks, October 30th, 11pm. I finished the frame  
> out of
> copper tube and couplings/t-joints, had re-created all the joints  
> out of
> hinges and springs, and sat staring at the finished frame. Needless  
> to say
> the fur-suit that would encompass the frame and myself was whipped  
> together
> so fast it looked absolutely horrible. I went to Salem, MA as Pan  
> that year,
> utilizing the fur legs and small leftover lengths of the copper  
> tube to
> create a pan-pipe.
>
> The next year was very similar in time-line, but this time I gave  
> myself
> FOUR weeks, came up with a completely different "locomotion" design  
> for the
> back legs involving a large central wheel contained within the  
> frame and
> connections aimed at my legs, and the back legs. It worked, but  
> again was
> missing the realistic fur-suit and had some minor design flaws.  
> This year I
> was batman for Halloween, with the centaur frame and suit laying in my
> closet.
>
> Staying true to form, this year, Halloween Season 07, I again  
> doubled the
> time to prepare giving myself EIGHT weeks. This year, I utilized a  
> 2-axle, 1
> driveshaft, gear driven system. The frame w/rotating assembly much  
> resembles
> that of a car. The rotating assembly and it's frame will be completed
> tomorrow, and then the skeleton of the centaur and the fur-suit  
> will be
> completed in what's left of october!
>
> PHEW, I hope you all didn't actually read all that. So do any of

> web-site/ftp-site/storage of any kind with pictures of the creation of

With all this mayhem, I fear getting in the middle! Well, I figure I better formally introduce myself. My name is J2, my newly founded furry name....Fox Tails. "Fox" because I find them cool, and I am quiet and a little bit of a lone wolf. Although I am more like a wolf, I am small....20 years, 5'5 1/2". Although I act like an adult, I look like a kid. "Tails" because I find Miles Tails from Sonic the Hedgehog to be cool. I am currently waiting to have my Fox Tails furry suit made for me. I live in the Southern California area, L.A. County. You can see who I am by checking my yahoo360 account and looking for J2. J2 out.....oh wait! Fox Tials out!

From wallyfox98 at hotmail.com  Wed Oct  3 12:21:10 2007
From: wallyfox98 at hotmail.com (Wally_Wabbit/Stephen H./Wallyfox)
Date: Wed, 3 Oct 2007 12:21:10 -0400
Subject: FL: Furfright Fursuiter Feast!
Message-ID: <BAY121-W6C6416BA5EAD3257F700ED0AF0@phx.gbl>


It was a tough decision and several factors came into play: votes, price, speed of service, wait times, and distance from the hotel.The Furfright Fursuiter Feast will be held at American Steakhouse 4 miles from the hotel. For those that are not familiar this restaurant is much like a Bonanza/Ponderosa.We will be meeting at 5pm in the main lobby of the hotel on Friday 10/19. From there we will carpool to the restaurant.If your planning to attend please send a private email to wallyfox98 at hotmail.com. I will need to know the following by Tuesday 10/16 (Restaurant would like an updated count 1-2 days prior):-Do you have your own transportation to the restaurant Yes or No?-If yes, would you be willing to carpool others? and how many can fit in your vehicle?Also note this restaurant is mainly buffet style and it requires all that are seated in the dining room to purchase a meal. A soda/glass of water may not cut it and meals range anywhere from $6.99 and up. Please have a peek at the menu before RSVP'ing: http://www.americansteakhouse.com/menu_waterbury.htmlFor those who would like to meet directly at the restaurant our reservation is set for 5:30PM and the address is below:American Steakhouse 



1011 Wolcott Rd. (Conn Rt 69)Waterbury, CT 06705 203-756-7529 http://www.americansteakhouse.com/locations.html(Restaurant is in the Price Chopper Plaza)
snugs

  From: John Arroyo

  Sent: Wednesday, October 03, 2007 12:36 AM
  Subject: Re: FL: quick introduction
  

With all this mayhem, I fear getting in the middle! Well, I figure I better formally introduce myself. My name is J2, my newly founded furry name....Fox Tails. "Fox" because I find them cool, and I am quiet and a little bit of a lone wolf. Although I am more like a wolf, I am small....20 years, 5'5 1/2". Although I act like an adult, I look like a kid. "Tails" because I find Miles Tails from Sonic the Hedgehog to be cool. I am currently waiting to have my Fox Tails furry suit made for me. I live in the Southern California area, L.A. County. You can see who I am by checking my yahoo360 account and looking for J2. J2 out.....oh wait! Fox Tials out!

Donkey <donkeyears at gmail.com> wrote:   I responded to the message with out looking at who posted it.
You know I dont like being boped! I like being feed carrets a lot
better. hint. Hint! HINT!!!

His Most Royally carret loving Highass, Donkey

From wallyfox98 at hotmail.com  Wed Oct  3 18:11:50 2007
From: wallyfox98 at hotmail.com (Wally_Wabbit/Stephen H./Wallyfox)
Date: Wed, 3 Oct 2007 18:11:50 -0400
Subject: FL: Furfright Fursuiter Feast-Clarification
In-Reply-To: <BAY121-W6C6416BA5EAD3257F700ED0AF0@phx.gbl>
References: <BAY121-W6C6416BA5EAD3257F700ED0AF0@phx.gbl>
Message-ID: <BAY121-W10BFC7535F23B5051D72EED0AF0@phx.gbl>



I forgot to mention:
 
This is an "out of suit" event for those who enjoy fursuiting and would like to socialize with other suiters! It has been done at past cons such as AC.

From: wallyfox98 at hotmail.comTo: fursuit-list at lists.fursuit.org; nefur at rut.org; newenglandfurs at yahoogroups.com; newenglandfurs_announce at yahoogroups.com; hudsonfur at catbox.com; ctfurs at yahoogroups.com; furfright at yahoogroups.comSubject: HF: Furfright Fursuiter Feast!Date: Wed, 3 Oct 2007 12:21:10 -0400


It was a tough decision and several factors came into play: votes, price, speed of service, wait times, and distance from the hotel.The Furfright Fursuiter Feast will be held at American Steakhouse 4 miles from the hotel. For those that are not familiar this restaurant is much like a Bonanza/Ponderosa.We will be meeting at 5pm in the main lobby of the hotel on Friday 10/19. From there we will carpool to the restaurant.If your planning to attend please send a private email to wallyfox98 at hotmail.com. I will need to know the following by Tuesday 10/16 (Restaurant would like an updated count 1-2 days prior):-Do you have your own transportation to the restaurant Yes or No?-If yes, would you be willing to carpool others? and how many can fit in your vehicle?Also note this restaurant is mainly buffet style and it requires all that are seated in the dining room to purchase a meal. A soda/glass of water may not cut it and meals range anywhere from $6.99 and up. Please have a peek at the menu before RSVP'ing: http://www.americansteakhouse.com/menu_waterbury.htmlFor those who would like to meet directly at the restaurant our reservation is set for 5:30PM and the address is below:American Steakhouse 



1011 Wolcott Rd. (Conn Rt 69)Waterbury, CT 06705 203-756-7529 http://www.americansteakhouse.com/locations.html(Restaurant is in the Price Chopper Plaza)snugs Wally_WabbitICQ=86653793 Wally_Wabbit on Furrymuck and Tapestries Wally_Wabbit on IRC/Yiffnet/Anthrochatwallyfox2001 on yahoo messengerhttp://www.livejournal.com/users/wally_wabbit/

Windows Live Hotmail and Microsoft Office Outlook ? together at last. Get it now!

I guess now is as good of a time as ever to introduce myself. My generally used nickname for all purposes- C.Lupus (that is the species name for wolves so it's fairly obvious who and what I am)
It's nice to know so many of us are in the southern california la county area. (not that I like it here- it's way to hot for my tastes- I always run up a huge A/C bill)
In my small city I know of one other furry, but he doesn't make any suits, though he was looking into buying one.
I've been at work for the last 4 months- planning(not to mention having over 10 other long term projects). I've bought a few materials but... I'll get around to making up my mind on a design soon (hopefully)!

> for next years Halloween....shoot....maybe even before that!!!

From game_wagon at yahoo.com  Thu Oct  4 20:39:56 2007
From: game_wagon at yahoo.com (D'Lorn)
Date: Thu, 4 Oct 2007 17:39:56 -0700 (PDT)
Subject: FL: quick introduction
Message-ID: <107443.67147.qm@web37903.mail.mud.yahoo.com>

*test?* Never posted, bear with me.

I have had better luck with new fursuit creators.  I scouted out for a good few months for folks that needed practice.  Found one that would work for just material costs, and didn't even attempt that (wanted someone with 'some!' experience)

Ended up ^by chance^ meeting an awesome guy at AC and he gave me a premium price of 800.  For a full suit mind, with special work on my ears.. and a movable jaw.  I think he should have charged more if the going price seems to be 1500???

Then again though.. I would have never bought it, would have got the materials and half a'ed it myself ya know?

Mattering on Materials ya, it would cost alot more if you did something really special.  I just had faux fur 13 bucks a yard for it, and a foam based head.  I'd say 1000 is good for a suit like that, any extras... ooh yea charge extra :D


From the soon to be crafter of 2008,

Dlorn

From jpa2blue at yahoo.com  Fri Oct  5 14:00:22 2007
From: jpa2blue at yahoo.com (John Arroyo)

In-Reply-To: <107443.67147.qm@web37903.mail.mud.yahoo.com>
Message-ID: <708369.88881.qm@web35307.mail.mud.yahoo.com>

Is there a website for this suit maker? As you can see, I really want to get the suit done...cheap price, but good quality. And when I mean good quality, I mean the head is proportional to the body, the suit fits semi-fit to the wearer (not loose), and the teeth and claws are some what realistic (hard plastic and not loose material), and a movable jaw.

From game_wagon at yahoo.com  Fri Oct  5 17:29:19 2007
From: game_wagon at yahoo.com (D'Lorn)
Date: Fri, 5 Oct 2007 14:29:19 -0700 (PDT)
Subject: FL: On the note of finding low priced suits
Message-ID: <806693.17328.qm@web37915.mail.mud.yahoo.com>

sorry to post again so quickly, but the lowest prices out today is professional sites that make the same suit again and again.  If your looking for something super cheap.. get one that someone is selling, that is used.  

Next?  Go to a place like http://realms.safeshopper.com/24/152.htm?361  (like may not work, but meh)  I went there to see what pre-fab stuff looked like, and it seems it's close to what I want.. and me a would-be suit creator, I'll add to it as needed/possible.

The  next step is to look for people on this list.  If they are willing the prices may be lower, but they will be higher than the above two, mostly due that these are real people with real lives, and the ones that would do it for lower price, most likely aren't full timing it.  Those that full time it are professional based and know the value of what they do.

So for those of you looking for a suit as premium price... talk ..talk.. talk, you may get lucky, but most likely you'll end up paying what they are worth. *grins*

I wish you all good luck on that.

~Dlorn

I bought two of the wolf half masks from Realms of Enchantment. They even
colored it different than the standerd colors that they come in. I like them
a lot.

As for the full costume heads I don't care for them. You have to turn your
body to look around. The heads only look forward. Other than that there not
bad suits. They do look good.

Donkey

From jc2blion at taconic.net  Sat Oct  6 08:08:21 2007
From: jc2blion at taconic.net (Kamau)
Date: Sat, 6 Oct 2007 08:08:21 -0400
Subject: FL: On the note of finding low priced suits
References: <806693.17328.qm@web37915.mail.mud.yahoo.com>
	<d23d76ca0710051746p1d039e90l25edf05393c0607c@mail.gmail.com>

I've found that it is relatively easy to mount a inexpensive work helmet in 
a Realms head which allows the head to move with yours.  Though I've got 
much better suits now I still use the Realms suit for certain functions. 
They are a very good starter suit IMHO.

Kamau

>> (like may not work, but meh)  I went there to see what pre-fab stuff 
>> looked
>> like, and it seems it's close to what I want.. and me a would-be suit
>> creator, I'll add to it as needed/possible.
>>
>> The  next step is to look for people on this list.  If they are willing
>> the prices may be lower, but they will be higher than the above two, 
>> mostly
>> due that these are real people with real lives, and the ones that would 
>> do
>> it for lower price, most likely aren't full timing it.  Those that full 
>> time
>> it are professional based and know the value of what they do.
>>
>> So for those of you looking for a suit as premium price... talk ..talk..
>> talk, you may get lucky, but most likely you'll end up paying what they 
>> are
>> worth. *grins*
>>
>> I wish you all good luck on that.
>>
>> ~Dlorn
>>
>>

J2 Fox Tails here! - Ehhh...The Realms suits look toooooo much like an actual mascot suit to me. I want to get something a little more unique. I have already been talking to Joecifur, it looks like I will be going with his service. Since I have never bought a suit before I don't know what is cheap and what is expensive....but I suppose $1300 to $1500 is not expensive at all when compared to other web services.

Kamau <jc2blion at taconic.net> wrote:  I've found that it is relatively easy to mount a inexpensive work helmet in 
a Realms head which allows the head to move with yours. Though I've got 
much better suits now I still use the Realms suit for certain functions. 
They are a very good starter suit IMHO.

Kamau

From wallyfox98 at hotmail.com  Wed Oct 10 17:39:49 2007
From: wallyfox98 at hotmail.com (Wally_Wabbit/Stephen H./Wallyfox)
Date: Wed, 10 Oct 2007 17:39:49 -0400
Subject: FL: HF: Furfright Fursuiter Feast!
In-Reply-To: <BAY121-W6C6416BA5EAD3257F700ED0AF0@phx.gbl>
References: <BAY121-W6C6416BA5EAD3257F700ED0AF0@phx.gbl>
Message-ID: <BAY121-W27416EC6FAB1743D1DB33AD0A60@phx.gbl>



Just an update:
 
I already have a number of folks planning to attend and several folks with car space! If you haven't already please read the message below and let me know your intentions my Tuesday 10/16. I will be giving the restaurant a count on Wednesday.
 
This is an out of suit event open to all fursuit performers, builders, fans, and curious folk.
 
There should be room for last minute folk and I will make a final post about things just before the con.
 
Original post/details below:
 
The Furfright Fursuiter Feast will be held at American Steakhouse 4 miles from the hotel. For those that are not familiar this restaurant is much like a Bonanza/Ponderosa.
 
We will be meeting at 5pm in the main lobby of the hotel on Friday 10/19. From there we will carpool to the restaurant. This is an "out of suit" event for those who enjoy fursuiting.
 
If your planning to attend please send a private email to wallyfox98 at hotmail.com. I will need to know the following by Tuesday 10/16 (Restaurant would like an updated count 1-2 days prior):
 
-Do you have your own transportation to the restaurant Yes or No?
 
-If yes, would you be willing to carpool others? and how many can fit in your vehicle?
 
Also note this restaurant is mainly buffet style and it requires all that are seated in the dining room to purchase a meal. A soda/glass of water may not cut it and meals range anywhere from $6.99 and up. Please have a peek at the menu before RSVP'ing: http://www.americansteakhouse.com/menu_waterbury.html
 
For those who would like to meet directly at the restaurant our reservation is set for 5:30PM and the address is below:
 
American Steakhouse 1011 Wolcott Rd. (Conn Rt 69)
Waterbury, CT 06705 
203-756-7529 
http://www.americansteakhouse.com/locations.html
(Restaurant is in the Price Chopper Plaza) 
 
snugs

From rtrabbitny at aol.com  Thu Oct 11 01:16:09 2007
From: rtrabbitny at aol.com (rtrabbitny at aol.com)
Date: Thu, 11 Oct 2007 01:16:09 -0400
Subject: FL: FWD: NJPIRG at Rutgers University NJ
Message-ID: <8C9D9DCF7C31C6D-1518-2CAA@FWM-M07.sysops.aol.com>

My name is Candace, I'm a student at Rutgers University, New Brunswick,
and I've been looking into the fursuit scene lately. I've noticed that
rapidtrabbit and foxwell seem to be
active in the New York and New Jersey areas, and I was wondering if any of
you or your friends could come down for a volunteering opportunity.

Nothing is solid yet, but it's for visibility for NJPIRG's student chapter
referendum. Every 3 years, a referendum is held at Rutgers University to
ensure that the majority of students are in agreement with having a
waiveable fee on their term bill that supports NJPIRG.

PIRG, the Public Interest Research Group, is actually a nationwide
institution, but here on the local level, and more specifically at our
university, we take on projects such as stream monitoring, river clean up,
food drives, aiding with the passage of global warming policies, and other
such activities that the students are concerned about.

As for your role in this, we need some eye-catching ways to attract people
to come vote in the referendum. Sorry for the short notice, but
referendum is taking place this upcoming week, and one of the first things
that popped in my mind is having a field of fursuiters dance for us! I
can't offer any compensation, but I'd be glad to make reservations at a
restaurant or diner for everyone to gather around later.

Of course, I'm totally open to other ideas as well. So let me know what
you think, and if anyone else is interested - tentative date for this would be Monday October 22 in the afternoon, and feel free to email me back at this address candychic125 at hotmail.com

Thanks in advance!
Candace 

PS- I'm making a red panda costume!
________________________________________________________________________
Email and AIM finally together. You've gotta check out free AOL Mail! - http://mail.aol.com

From wallyfox98 at hotmail.com  Wed Oct 17 10:53:53 2007
From: wallyfox98 at hotmail.com (Wally_Wabbit/Stephen H./Wallyfox)
Date: Wed, 17 Oct 2007 10:53:53 -0400
Subject: FL: Furfright Fursuiter Feast Finalized!
In-Reply-To: <BAY121-W6C6416BA5EAD3257F700ED0AF0@phx.gbl>
References: <BAY121-W6C6416BA5EAD3257F700ED0AF0@phx.gbl>
Message-ID: <BAY121-W33E63BDED5FA893BBCBCE6D09D0@phx.gbl>



I want to say "Thank You" to everyone who RSVP'd. The restaurant is expecting about 30 of us (give or take a few). There is still room for stragglers. I ask that you try and find me at the con before the event in case I need to give them another count. I don't want to surprise them too much.
 
We will be meeting in the lobby at 5pm Friday and carpooling from there. We are leaving the hotel @5:30 with or without you so please be ready. If you are running late please meet us directly at the restaurant @5:45pm (see directions).
 
-Carpool Directions/Coupons will be provided to all who meet in the lobby of the hotel (limited supply of coupons-also on their website).
 
-Please dress accordingly- Ears/Tails are fine full fursuits are not reccomended. 
 
-Remember we will be in public and to act accordingly. We want to make a nice impression!
 
-Restaurant does require you to pay first and since a buffet is included in all meals they will require purchase of at least the buffet. If your not eating or just want a soda you will not be seated.
 
-Beer and Wine are available to those over 21. If you are driving DO NOT DRINK!
 
See you Friday! 
 
Don't forget to check out The "Furry Icebreaker/ Q &A" Panel Friday at 1pm and the "Furry Finances Panel" on Sunday at 10AM (Time has been changed)!
 
Oriiginal Post/details/directions below
 
-------------------------------------
 
The Furfright Fursuiter Feast will be held at American Steakhouse 4 miles from the hotel. For those that are not familiar this restaurant is much like a Bonanza/Ponderosa.
 
We will be meeting at 5pm in the main lobby of the hotel on Friday 10/19. From there we will carpool to the restaurant. This is an "out of suit" event for those who enjoy fursuiting.
 
If your planning to attend please send a private email to wallyfox98 at hotmail.com. I will need to know the following by Tuesday 10/16 (Restaurant would like an updated count 1-2 days prior):
 
-Do you have your own transportation to the restaurant Yes or No?
-If yes, would you be willing to carpool others? and how many can fit in your vehicle?
 
Also note this restaurant is mainly buffet style and it requires all that are seated in the dining room to purchase a meal. A soda/glass of water may not cut it and meals range anywhere from $6.99 and up. Please have a peek at the menu before RSVP'ing: http://www.americansteakhouse.com/menu_waterbury.html
 
For those who would like to meet directly at the restaurant our reservation is set for 5:30PM and the address/directions are below:
 
American Steakhouse 
1011 Wolcott Rd. (Conn Rt 69)
Waterbury, CT 06705 
203-756-7529 
http://www.americansteakhouse.com/locations.html
(Restaurant is in the Price Chopper Plaza) 
 
Turn Left onto East Main Street follow for about 2 miles
Right onto Frost Road. 
Follow Frost until you hit the intersection with Woodtick Road. Make a slight left onto Woodtick Road 
After the slight left go straight ahead onto Frost Road (Frost and Woodtick overlap briefly)
Follow Frost until it ends. Make a right onto Stillson Road (CT Rt 69 North)
Follow Stillson Road for 1/2 mile
Make a right at the end onto Wolcott Road (CT Rt 69 North) (at abandoned mobil gas station)
Restaurant is on your left in the Price Chopper Plaza. There is also an entrance off Lakewood Road (left at next intersection left into plaza)
 
snugs

Shortwave Husky (figures, a husky!) makes them, and coincidentally just 
posted an LJ entry about 
them:  http://shortwave81.livejournal.com/57630.html  They're the basic 
nylon type, not the fancy tailored leather type that Jase Husky wears.  But 
I can say that they are strong, as Shortwave used his to pull a car!

-- TJCoyote

I got mine from http://www.adanacsleds.com/, their largest
size harness would fir me out of suit, and only required a
little modification and about a foot of webbing to fit in
suit.  However, it would probably look better made oversize
for a fursuit character.

From francisco-sender-6f5fe9 at vulpes.net  Tue Oct 30 22:56:46 2007
From: francisco-sender-6f5fe9 at vulpes.net (Francisco Azinsan)
Date: Tue, 30 Oct 2007 21:56:46 -0500
Subject: FL: FC2008 October Newsletter
Message-ID: <20071031025646.GA78627@critter.net>


Further Confusion 2008 News Letter for October 2007.

1. Furry Market Place spaces still available
2. FNL08 - will it be YEAR OF THE NINJA
3. We welcome our second Guest of Honor
4. We need DJ's
5. The next meeting is November 11th

-------------------------------------------------------------------------

1. Furry Market Place spaces still available

Yes, we still have some of these spaces left at the time of this
writing. If you want a space in the Furry Market Place, head on over
to the dealers page at the Further Confusion website and read the details,
download the PDF, fill it out, write a check for US $65.00 and get it sent
in to us.  That price INCLUDES a full membership to the convention. These
remaining spaces are not going to last long, and we will CLOSE sales on
December 1st, 2007 even if there are spaces left, so get your order
in soon!


2. FNL08 - will it be YEAR OF THE NINJA

Time is getting short to get involved with Furry Night Live 2008! This is
the marquee event for FC's Sunday evening, featuring a variety of furry
acts performed live. New this year we are accepting short video segments
to complement the on-stage acts. If you have an act or are otherwise
interested in participating, it is vital you join the FNL08 discussion
mailing list at <http://www.furtherconfusion.org/fc2008/signup/fnl>
(FNL007 list membership does not carry over to FNL08)

PLEASE NOTE: We will be shooting for a rough lineup by mid-January,
and space is limited. Don't wait for FC itself! Also watch for news
about the new website http://www.furrynightlive.org/ and the
"furrynightlive" LiveJournal community!


3. We welcome our second Guest of Honor 

We are pleased to announce the second Guest of Honor for Further
Confusion 2008.  Dave Barclay, of PerformFX will be joining us in
January.  Dave is a professional puppeteer whose credits range from
Cats and Dogs (working as the lead performance coordinator) to Who
Framed Roger Rabbit (the lead puppeteer) to the Star Wars saga
(puppeteer of Jabba the Hutt), and many, many more.

We are honored to bring this master-level puppeteer to our event, and
expect him to bring some of his puppets to demonstrate their use.
Between artist Moira Hahn and puppeteer Dave Barclay, not to mention
special performer Alexander James Adams, we expect this to be a year you
won't soon forget.


4. We need DJ's

We are still seeking a few good furs to help out with the dances for
this upcoming FC in January.  If you like to make people dance, or
watch them dance, or even draw them dance, this is for you.  This is
also for you if you just like music and not really into dancing.

We're still seeking some people who can do real time video mixing.
Wanna be a VJ?  Email and let's talk.  Also, we're planning some new
things this year like Live Action Drawing.  If you want to be under
the spotlight and drawing while listening to the music and watching
people dancing all around you, shoot us an email.

DJ's, we've gotten many submissions, but still need some more.  We'll
be finalizing the schedule at the end of the month, so get a demo in
now if you're interested.  In particular, we're in need of DJ's who
can do non-techno styles (rock, pop, 80's, etc...)  You don't need to
be a master DJ mixer, just need to have a good selection of music.
And we also are in need of some DJ's who can do down-tempo/ambient for
the second area during the main dance.  (And yes, still accepting
demos of every style for all the dances - the schedule has not been
set yet!!!)

If you're interested in any of this stuff, or helping out with the
dances in any way you can imagine, send an email to
dj-submissions at furtherconfusion.org

If you've previously sent in an email, but never heard back from
anyone, don't be afraid to send it again.  We'd rather get 2 emails
from you than none at all.


5. The next meeting is November 10th:

Please come and join us for the next public Further Confusion staff
meeting. Many of our departments are still looking for helpful furs.  Come
be part of something great and volunteer. This con would be impossible
without the help of well over 150 staffers. The meeting starts at noon at
our wonderful Double Tree Hotel in San Jose. Look at any LCD screen for
"Further Confusion..." to see what meeting room we are in.


-- 
Further Confusion
info at furtherconfusion.org
http://www.furtherconfusion.org/

From loopfurwalker at yahoo.com  Mon Nov  5 12:00:33 2007
From: loopfurwalker at yahoo.com (loop furwalker)
Date: Mon, 5 Nov 2007 09:00:33 -0800 (PST)
Subject: FL: My ideas for fur-suits.....etc.....
Message-ID: <366220.98141.qm@web58410.mail.re3.yahoo.com>

I would like to, first-off, I would like to try either a wolf or a coyote suit. (Or something in a catalog or other "informational-books".......etc......)
   
  I don't have the measurements with me at the moment,yet, (I'm using somebody else's computer for now), but, as I've said above, I would like to try "passing-on" my ideas for fur-suits......etc....or just the artworks and technical drawings I've come up with over the past couple of years since I *discovered* the "worlds-of-furry-ness", as well as the others....etc....
   
  (I've looked up in comics and "real-based" books fo all the information I can about the above subjects I've mentioned.....etc......I even tried looking up some of the RPG system games too ------- My  favorites are Rift (don't have any books yet, though), and Werewolf: The Apocalypse -------- You should see my "orders-from-borders", about $350.00 per "pile" or "stack" of books, magazines, comics, and other related materials......etc....)
   
  For the most part I like the statistics and general information for each of the products I've purchased so far, also, the "art" of course ------ I lkie the way the artists "do-their-thing".
   
  (I've purchased things (for Apocalypse) like the "Story-Teller's Screen" (I love *generating* worlds, characters, and other related materials--------I also, of course everybody does, like Star Wars and Star Trek items.........plus the whole genre of science fiction and fantasy-------------------studying each auther's styles and techniques from their books to TV and movie-related items.......I've been trying to get different ideas for costumes. (As I've said before: I love to draw and write------When I run out of one thing (paper/writing paper) I go back to the other mediums------no drawing paper----write------no writing paper-----draw---------too bad I don't have a scanner to show you my *millions* of drawings......some colored, some not.)
   
  Enough about that for now -----------more later as you get to know me (I hope we have a "good-relationship" (whomever I'm writing to----------no, I'm not gay but I like "furry" stuff for some "sexual" and "ethical" reasons --------- probably from my "weird-childhood" and how I got to be this way when I grew up-----------now I'm at "middle-age" (40 years old approx.)
   
  (If you want *my* stats I'll give you as much as I can ------ don't worry I won't ask you for any money like Dafur (I've got 450 messages or "hits" in my file----they drive me crazy!!), unless you offer a catalog or other books, refs, etc.......let me know what's up if you (or I) do anything further)
   
  My Wolf (or Coyote) characters: (at least a little bit about one, the other, or both---for now)
   
  Gender: Adult male (wolf or coyote, maybe a suggestion of another animal or other creatures)----- approx. my age (40 or 40+, or older or younger-----it depends if the character has "signs-of-aging" (crowsfeet, or some-other type of "ailment".....etc....I won't go into details myself, unless I (or you) want to, or whatever. Whatever comes of this!!)
   
  Colorization: (prefs include "real" colors from tan to black ---- descisions will come later on)
   
  Fur thickness: very smooth or very thick ------ depending on the character's backgrounds....etc....) Younger characters have "light" fur while older ones have "thick" fur.
   
  Costume: (if any) ------ character will either be "nude" or "natural" if I choose to have him that way, or, if the character has a costume make it a vest with a t-shirt underneath (white), and, if he wears pants (unless my costume has a tail, or "hole" in the back for a tail), depending on that, I might just "through-some-things-on" myself------unless you've got "pictures" and/or "attatchments" to send me or let me know what Ideas you've had (and others) over the years since you've started.....etc.....) (I'll let you know what I want------if/when I want to know things).
   
  Accessories: old-weapons, Star Wars or Star Trek props (I've got two "defunct" communicators from the old series and a "defunct" "phaser-2" (what Kirk and Spock carry on their "away-missions"--------plus I've got a whole lot of sound effect and music CD's------mostly from the "above", as well as "Dr. Demeto" stuff and Disney recordings and movies------------I like stuff like that-----I've also got a whole collection of art books (for both "real" and "imaginary" character refs.........I miss some of the "un-related" game books I've had------I moved----they didn't!! (I no longer trust my "direct-relatives"-------they "robbed-me-blind" or threw things I away when I went away to school.......etc....untrustworthy!! I've been "trying-to-get-all-my-books-back" the "hard-way": just looking up what I've had and adding on some more materials....etc.....) As Stan Lee says in his "mail-bag"----- 'Nuff said!!)
   
  ***** You can tell what I like when I make reffs to different things *****
   
  Background: (I've got millions of them, depending on my characters of old to the present ones.......etc.....I'll let you know a few at a time------otherwise I'll be "blowing-your-mind" too!!)
   
  (Some of my characters are "post-apocalyptic", "genetic-lifeforms", and/or "werewolf-hybrids"---------I've studied most of the "real" animal species too, to get that sort-of information....etc.....other characters are just "regular"-----like cartoon and/or comic-book-style characters--------most of the ideas are 1. My own, and 2. things I've gotten out of libraries, bookstores, and other "places-of-knowledge".....etc....you should see my *collection* ------ its "VERY-HUGE"!!! (depending on the "buying/selling-processes" I've got and "finagled" over the years......bit-by-bit its gotten large and larger------If I move again, hopefully not for a long time, I'm going to photo-copy and put my texts and drawings on my computer-links (general, no internet at my house yet), and put them inside a *HUGE* archive-stack for wherever I go in this life ----- I'll stop off and pick up my fur-suit in the mean-time too, wherever it will be made, and/or purchased by me------I'm also
 *Dying" to go to a "Fur-Con" or other type of convention----but, as I've mentioned before, in another place, I live in a place called Keene, New Hampshire (deep in the heart of the "backwoods" territories. There's cities and towns around but the people around here still like to use "apples and oranges" for their computers and othe things------I also love the way everybody still uses "Netscape-Navigator" for internet "blogging" -----I've been around----I know what's out there, in the "Great-Beyond"!! Apple2E's are so much fun ----- I also like using the "Happy-Macs" they have at the local colleges and schools around here ------ a sort-of "techno-western-motif")
   
  The "background" itself:
   
  Character 1: A large male wolf (or coyote, or other animal-form).....................
   
  (For this "experiment" I'll choose a "tan" fur color, bushy body-hairs and a large bushy tail at the back -------- for the "facial-features" I'd like a "big-bad-wolf" motif: "My what big ears, eyes, nose, snout, teeth, mane, and other "features".....etc....naked or clothed.....etc....)
   
  (The character is kind of like me---the same kind of "regular-muscular" motif ----- I don't work out that much but I do excersice a lot ------- walking and "hanging-out-with-my-friends" downtown--------just the way a "phase 1" character would look ---- unless I specify anything different-------I'll try to get you some "PG-rated" (clothed) pictures of myself-----through attatchments or "postal-mails" ---- or I'll just describe things as I want them....etc....)
   
  (The character is single ----- unless he looks into "Animal E-Harmony" ---- 29 dimensions of "beastiality" ------ see the "local-zoos" for mor details.....etc.....he might ask for a "girlfriend" at somepoint. Character does not wish to have "relatives" mentioned at this time,as of yet)
   
  More information later -------- I've got to go because I was "told" to "vamoose!!" by the person "running" the organization that I'm using ---- they all frown on people using other applications on the web ----- like "non-job" ones.........I wish I had the web at home, but I don't!! Sorry!!)
   
  (I'll give you "my-regs" later, in a letter or email......or whatever!!)
   
  As I say to everybody:
   
  Buy, bye, and reply!!
   
  (Until the "next-dimension)......

From loopfurwalker at yahoo.com  Mon Nov  5 12:00:41 2007
From: loopfurwalker at yahoo.com (loop furwalker)
Date: Mon, 5 Nov 2007 09:00:41 -0800 (PST)
Subject: FL: My ideas for fur-suits.....etc.....
Message-ID: <967369.14284.qm@web58413.mail.re3.yahoo.com>

I would like to, first-off, I would like to try either a wolf or a coyote suit. (Or something in a catalog or other "informational-books".......etc......)
   
  I don't have the measurements with me at the moment,yet, (I'm using somebody else's computer for now), but, as I've said above, I would like to try "passing-on" my ideas for fur-suits......etc....or just the artworks and technical drawings I've come up with over the past couple of years since I *discovered* the "worlds-of-furry-ness", as well as the others....etc....
   
  (I've looked up in comics and "real-based" books fo all the information I can about the above subjects I've mentioned.....etc......I even tried looking up some of the RPG system games too ------- My  favorites are Rift (don't have any books yet, though), and Werewolf: The Apocalypse -------- You should see my "orders-from-borders", about $350.00 per "pile" or "stack" of books, magazines, comics, and other related materials......etc....)
   
  For the most part I like the statistics and general information for each of the products I've purchased so far, also, the "art" of course ------ I lkie the way the artists "do-their-thing".
   
  (I've purchased things (for Apocalypse) like the "Story-Teller's Screen" (I love *generating* worlds, characters, and other related materials--------I also, of course everybody does, like Star Wars and Star Trek items.........plus the whole genre of science fiction and fantasy-------------------studying each auther's styles and techniques from their books to TV and movie-related items.......I've been trying to get different ideas for costumes. (As I've said before: I love to draw and write------When I run out of one thing (paper/writing paper) I go back to the other mediums------no drawing paper----write------no writing paper-----draw---------too bad I don't have a scanner to show you my *millions* of drawings......some colored, some not.)
   
  Enough about that for now -----------more later as you get to know me (I hope we have a "good-relationship" (whomever I'm writing to----------no, I'm not gay but I like "furry" stuff for some "sexual" and "ethical" reasons --------- probably from my "weird-childhood" and how I got to be this way when I grew up-----------now I'm at "middle-age" (40 years old approx.)
   
  (If you want *my* stats I'll give you as much as I can ------ don't worry I won't ask you for any money like Dafur (I've got 450 messages or "hits" in my file----they drive me crazy!!), unless you offer a catalog or other books, refs, etc.......let me know what's up if you (or I) do anything further)
   
  My Wolf (or Coyote) characters: (at least a little bit about one, the other, or both---for now)
   
  Gender: Adult male (wolf or coyote, maybe a suggestion of another animal or other creatures)----- approx. my age (40 or 40+, or older or younger-----it depends if the character has "signs-of-aging" (crowsfeet, or some-other type of "ailment".....etc....I won't go into details myself, unless I (or you) want to, or whatever. Whatever comes of this!!)
   
  Colorization: (prefs include "real" colors from tan to black ---- descisions will come later on)
   
  Fur thickness: very smooth or very thick ------ depending on the character's backgrounds....etc....) Younger characters have "light" fur while older ones have "thick" fur.
   
  Costume: (if any) ------ character will either be "nude" or "natural" if I choose to have him that way, or, if the character has a costume make it a vest with a t-shirt underneath (white), and, if he wears pants (unless my costume has a tail, or "hole" in the back for a tail), depending on that, I might just "through-some-things-on" myself------unless you've got "pictures" and/or "attatchments" to send me or let me know what Ideas you've had (and others) over the years since you've started.....etc.....) (I'll let you know what I want------if/when I want to know things).
   
  Accessories: old-weapons, Star Wars or Star Trek props (I've got two "defunct" communicators from the old series and a "defunct" "phaser-2" (what Kirk and Spock carry on their "away-missions"--------plus I've got a whole lot of sound effect and music CD's------mostly from the "above", as well as "Dr. Demeto" stuff and Disney recordings and movies------------I like stuff like that-----I've also got a whole collection of art books (for both "real" and "imaginary" character refs.........I miss some of the "un-related" game books I've had------I moved----they didn't!! (I no longer trust my "direct-relatives"-------they "robbed-me-blind" or threw things I away when I went away to school.......etc....untrustworthy!! I've been "trying-to-get-all-my-books-back" the "hard-way": just looking up what I've had and adding on some more materials....etc.....) As Stan Lee says in his "mail-bag"----- 'Nuff said!!)
   
  ***** You can tell what I like when I make reffs to different things *****
   
  Background: (I've got millions of them, depending on my characters of old to the present ones.......etc.....I'll let you know a few at a time------otherwise I'll be "blowing-your-mind" too!!)
   
  (Some of my characters are "post-apocalyptic", "genetic-lifeforms", and/or "werewolf-hybrids"---------I've studied most of the "real" animal species too, to get that sort-of information....etc.....other characters are just "regular"-----like cartoon and/or comic-book-style characters--------most of the ideas are 1. My own, and 2. things I've gotten out of libraries, bookstores, and other "places-of-knowledge".....etc....you should see my *collection* ------ its "VERY-HUGE"!!! (depending on the "buying/selling-processes" I've got and "finagled" over the years......bit-by-bit its gotten large and larger------If I move again, hopefully not for a long time, I'm going to photo-copy and put my texts and drawings on my computer-links (general, no internet at my house yet), and put them inside a *HUGE* archive-stack for wherever I go in this life ----- I'll stop off and pick up my fur-suit in the mean-time too, wherever it will be made, and/or purchased by me------I'm also
 *Dying" to go to a "Fur-Con" or other type of convention----but, as I've mentioned before, in another place, I live in a place called Keene, New Hampshire (deep in the heart of the "backwoods" territories. There's cities and towns around but the people around here still like to use "apples and oranges" for their computers and othe things------I also love the way everybody still uses "Netscape-Navigator" for internet "blogging" -----I've been around----I know what's out there, in the "Great-Beyond"!! Apple2E's are so much fun ----- I also like using the "Happy-Macs" they have at the local colleges and schools around here ------ a sort-of "techno-western-motif")
   
  The "background" itself:
   
  Character 1: A large male wolf (or coyote, or other animal-form).....................
   
  (For this "experiment" I'll choose a "tan" fur color, bushy body-hairs and a large bushy tail at the back -------- for the "facial-features" I'd like a "big-bad-wolf" motif: "My what big ears, eyes, nose, snout, teeth, mane, and other "features".....etc....naked or clothed.....etc....)
   
  (The character is kind of like me---the same kind of "regular-muscular" motif ----- I don't work out that much but I do excersice a lot ------- walking and "hanging-out-with-my-friends" downtown--------just the way a "phase 1" character would look ---- unless I specify anything different-------I'll try to get you some "PG-rated" (clothed) pictures of myself-----through attatchments or "postal-mails" ---- or I'll just describe things as I want them....etc....)
   
  (The character is single ----- unless he looks into "Animal E-Harmony" ---- 29 dimensions of "beastiality" ------ see the "local-zoos" for mor details.....etc.....he might ask for a "girlfriend" at somepoint. Character does not wish to have "relatives" mentioned at this time,as of yet)
   
  More information later -------- I've got to go because I was "told" to "vamoose!!" by the person "running" the organization that I'm using ---- they all frown on people using other applications on the web ----- like "non-job" ones.........I wish I had the web at home, but I don't!! Sorry!!)
   
  (I'll give you "my-regs" later, in a letter or email......or whatever!!)
   
  As I say to everybody:
   
  Buy, bye, and reply!!
   
  (Until the "next-dimension)......

From dlely at juno.com  Tue Nov  6 02:31:31 2007
From: dlely at juno.com (David L. Ely)
Date: Mon, 5 Nov 2007 23:31:31 -0800
Subject: FL: Pasadena (CA) Doo Dah Parade
Message-ID: <20071105.233239.4284.1.dlely@juno.com>

Fellow Doo Dahers:
 
It's my sad duty to report that there will NOT be a 31st Occasional
Pasadena Doo Dah Parade this calendar year as it has been postponed for
unknown reasons until Sunday the 20th of January 2008 (the Sunday before
Further Confusion 2008).
 
Despite this inconvenience I do plan on organizing the Coast to Coast
Critters group for this new date if enough interest exists.  In the mean
time, who's up for a "What the Heck, Let's Get Together For Lunch
Anyway!" gathering in Old Pasadena on the old Doo Dah Parade date (Sunday
18 November)?  If interested, contact me off-list at dlely at juno.com
 
David L. Ely - AKA: Scruff E. Coyote - dlely at juno.com
"How many hearts with warm blood in them are beating
under the cover of the woods . . . .   A multitude of
animal people, intimately related to us . . . are busy
about their own affairs as we are about ours." - John Muir

From baar_bear at cox.net  Fri Nov 23 01:17:56 2007
From: baar_bear at cox.net (Michael Setzer)
Date: Thu, 22 Nov 2007 23:17:56 -0700
Subject: FL: Ba'ar's Fan Club
Message-ID: <47467094.6060702@cox.net>

    Greetings all, Ba'ar here. For a while now you've been visiting my 
fursuiting website (http;//baarsden.itgo.com-which, in my ever so humble 
opinion, is rather cool.;-D).. I thank you for that.  I also do updates 
from time to time to make my website bigger and better.  If you'd like 
to know when I do, join Ba'ar's fan club.  It's a free mailing list that 
lets you know when I do update the site and what I've done to make the 
site even better than before. It's easy and best of all free.   Just 
send e-mail to baarsfanclub-subscribe at googlegroups.com (or if you prefer 
go to my website, click on the 'Ba'ar's Fan Club' link and follow the 
instructions that you get).  Thanks for listening.


From francisco-sender-6f5fe9 at vulpes.net  Tue Nov 27 20:15:39 2007
From: francisco-sender-6f5fe9 at vulpes.net (Francisco Azinsan)
Date: Tue, 27 Nov 2007 19:15:39 -0600
Subject: FL: FC2008 November Newsletter
Message-ID: <20071128011539.GA13437@critter.net>

Further Confusion 2008 - November Newsletter

In this issue:
1.  Pre-Registration closes December 30th
2.  FCTV Needs Your Help
3.  Furry Night Live '08 - Ninja Master seeks disciples
4.  Art Show is Sold Out
5.  Furry Market Place almost Sold Out
6.  Species Track Panel Information
7.  Would you like to take a survey?
8.  Further Confusion 2008 in Second Life
9.  Next Public Meeting

                                . o O o . 

1.  Pre-Registration closes December 30th

Just a reminder that with the holidays fast approaching, the deadline for
pre-registration cutoff is 11:59pm (Pacific time) December 30th.

<http://www.furtherconfusion.org/fc2008/registration>


2.  FCTV Needs Your Help

FCTV is seeking staff to help with our production at Further Confusion
2008! If you have any experience in any of the following areas, please
send a short blurb about your skills to fctv at furtherconfusion.org. We are
looking for the following:

- Camera Operators
- Video Switcher Operator (aka, Technical Director)
- Technical Assistant

We're mostly looking for camera operators. This will mostly entail you
operating a camera on a tripod. You must be able to follow directions from
the director on a headset and know how to smoothly pan, tilt and zoom a
camera when you're on "Live". We will need you during most of the main
events happening at main stage. Provided we have enough volunteers for
camera, you won't need to be on a camera at all events (unless you want to
be).

We also need camera operators to do handheld video for events such as
Critter Olympics and other panels as needed. This means you should have a
steady hand if you're doing something where a tripod is not applicable,
and be able to keep a reasonable shot at other times if you are on a
tripod

For Video Switcher, we need someone who can operate a video switcher
(Training can be provided, but prior experience is a big bonus) and follow
directions from the director. This basically means you listen to the
director to tell you which camera to switch to, and switch to that camera
when told. In some circumstances, when the director is not available, the
video switcher will need to make their own decisions about which camera to
go to.

Technical assistant will help FCTV Lead and/or Second with technical
related tasks. This may include running cables, hooking up equipment and
running tapes and batteries around to camera operators during a live
performance.


If any of these things sound interesting to you, and you can spare some
time (Even if for just 1 event), please email fctv at furtherconfusion.org.


3.  Furry Night Live '08 - Ninja Master seeks disciples

Ninja SUMMON! We are seeking intrepid souls who are organized, punctual
and silent to fill our Stage Ninja Dojo. Please contact us at
fnl at furtherconfusion.org

Furry Night Live 2008 approaches quickly! FC's Sunday evening stage show
features a variety of furry acts performed live. New this year we are
accepting short video segments to complement the live on-stage acts. If
you have an act or are otherwise interested in participating, it is vital
you join the FNL08 discussion mailing list at
<http://www.furtherconfusion.org/fc2008/signup/fnl>

PLEASE NOTE: We will be shooting for a rough lineup by mid-January, and
space is limited. If you have any special requirements beyond plain CD/DVD
playback - live audio, instruments, or other custom audio sources, be sure
to contact us at fnl at furtherconfusion.org or we may not be able to fulfill
your needs. Don't wait for FC itself! Also watch for news about the new
website <http://www.furrynightlive.org/> and the "furrynightlive"
LiveJournal community!


4.  Art Show is Sold Out

General space in the art show is sold out. Any new applications may be put
onto our waiting list in case panels open up later on. Also, if you intend
to bring art to the show "just in case", please e-mail us at
artshow at furtherconfusion.org so we can plan, and keep you informed.


5.  Furry Market Place almost Sold Out

The Furry Market Place is almost sold out. Sales will close on December
1st, 2007. At the time of this writing there are only 3 spaces left.


6.  Species Track Panel Information

For all you species panel enthusiasts, we have 12 different panels this
year.  All the regulars will be represented, including aquatic furs,
avians, canines, dragons & scalies, felines, foxes, hybrid furs,
minotaurs, and rodents. But we've also got two new ones:  Gryphons and
Rabbits.  Panels begin Thursday evening at 9pm with the last one ending on
Sunday at 3:30pm.  Come and enjoy both fact and fiction, fans and
specialists!


7.  Would you like to take a survey?

Further Confusion Gaming needs you! This year will feature the FC debut of
Fur-mily Feud, and we need survey answers! The first set of questions has
already been posted to the 'furcon' LiveJournal and our forums (at
<http://www.furtherconfusion.org/forums/>), and a new set will be posted
every Thursday. Every answer you give us helps us put on a great show!
Also, starting in December, FC Gaming will start accepting applications
for five-player teams to play Fur-mily Feud live at FC! You don't want to
miss this great new show!  Details for how to apply will be posted
separately. 


8.  Further Confusion 2008 in Second Life

If you play SecondLife be sure to come visit our beautiful themed club
house on Critter Valley at (164, 162, 22). Get your free tee shirts from
the vendors in our information kiosk, collect the whole set! Join our
group "FURther CONfusion"(note the spelling) - its free too! Come
enjoy a variety of games in our games park just over the bridge to the
south of the club house area.


9.  Next Public Meeting

Our next staff meeting will be December 15th starting at noon in the San
Jose Doubletree. Come be part of something great and volunteer. Look at
any LCD screen for "Further Confusion..." to see what meeting room we are
in.

-- 
Further Confusion
info at furtherconfusion.org
<http://www.furtherconfusion.org/>

From: minnieme4rl at aol.com (minnieme4rl at aol.com)
Date: Thu, 29 Nov 2007 13:18:06 -0500
Subject: FL: Fwd: Fwd(2): virus warning
In-Reply-To: <00AE44BC9CFA9D4BB256656ACD8EF79F01B37DBC@cuhsd-ex2003.cuhsd-int.prv>
References: <00AE44BC9CFA9D4BB256656ACD8EF79F01B37DBC@cuhsd-ex2003.cuhsd-int.prv>
Message-ID: <8CA00CB52889484-AC8-A98@webmail-me17.sysops.aol.com>




-----Original Message-----
From: Kristen Kim <kkim at cuhsd.org>
To: minnieme4rl at aol.com
Sent: Thu, 29 Nov 2007 10:16 am
Subject: FW: Fwd(2): virus warning





-----Original Message-----
From: Jim Bojorquez 
Sent: Thursday, November 29, 2007 9:21 AM
To: All Users
Subject: FW: Fwd(2): virus warning

Just in case.

-----Original Message-----
From: Kris Estrada [mailto:Kris_Estrada at sjusd.org] 
Sent: Thursday, November 29, 2007 8:59 AM
To: Jim Bojorquez; Patricia Sepulveda; Patti Vongsa
Subject: Fwd(2): virus warning

Good Morning Friends,

I haven't read the news yet, or listened to the radio to hear about this
reported virus, but just in case:

Michael, do you have a disk I could borrow to run anti-virus on my
school computer.....I know it is infected in the Microsoft suite.

Thanks and a hug to each of you,

Mary 


Anyone-using Internet mail such as Yahoo, Hotmail, AOL and so on. 

This information arrived this morning, Direct from both Microsoft and
Norton. 

Please send it to everybody you know who has access to the Internet. 

You may receive an apparently harmless e-mail with a Power Point 
presentation ' Life is Beautiful '

If you receive it DO NOT OPEN THE FILE UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCE S, 
and delete it immediately.

If you open this file, a message will appear on your screen saying: 

'It is too late now, your life is no longer beautiful.' 

Subsequently you will LOSE EVERYTHING IN YOUR PC, and the person who
sent it to you will gain access to your name, e-mail and password. 

This is a new virus which started to circulate on Saturday afternoon. 

AOL has already confirmed the severity, and the anti virus software's
are not capable of destroying it.

The virus has been created by a hacker who calls himself 'life owner.' 

PLEASE SEND A COPY OF TH IS E-MAIL TO ALL YOUR FRIENDS, and ask them to
PASS IT ON IMMEDIATELY!         


________________________________________________________________________
More new features than ever.  Check out the new AOL Mail ! - http://o.aolcdn.com/cdn.webmail.aol.com/mailtour/aol/en-us/text.htm?ncid=aolcmp00050000000003

From matrixportal at gmail.com  Thu Nov 29 15:41:42 2007
From: matrixportal at gmail.com (B C)
Date: Thu, 29 Nov 2007 15:41:42 -0500
Subject: FL: Fwd: Fwd(2): virus warning
In-Reply-To: <8CA00CB52889484-AC8-A98@webmail-me17.sysops.aol.com>
References: <00AE44BC9CFA9D4BB256656ACD8EF79F01B37DBC@cuhsd-ex2003.cuhsd-int.prv>
	<8CA00CB52889484-AC8-A98@webmail-me17.sysops.aol.com>
Message-ID: <c9a8951e0711291241x63e6a4a8kb494ae6988dd0e2d@mail.gmail.com>

This is Hoax from 2002 !!!!!

*PLEASE look into something before fowarding it!*

*You* *are only contributing to the chain mail / junk mail problem if you
don't!*
**
that is what google is for    http://www.google.com   using the search term
*"life is beautiful virus"* turned up these results (it took 2 seconds to
find out it is a hoax)

http://www.symantec.com/security_response/writeup.jsp?docid=2002-011511-0444-99
http://www.snopes.com/computer/virus/life.asp
http://www.breakthechain.org/exclusives/lifevirus.html
